oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A non-chemical method for monitoring adult olive weevil populations in Tadla-Azilal plain in Morocco
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: EL JIATI, Abdelazize
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The olive weevil becomes one of the major olive pests in Tadla-Azilal in Morocco. The chemical control is expensive and of low efficiency. Its application at night complicates the task for olive growers. An alternative non-chemical method has been developed using polyester fiber as a trap. It has a high efficiency, low cost and might be advised to organic olive farmers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: EL JIATI, Abdelazize (2008) A non-chemical method for monitoring adult olive weevil populations in Tadla-Azilal plain in Morocco. Paper at: IFOAM OWC 2008, Modena, Italy, 18-20 June 2008. [Submitted]
